title: cs-agv: bd sync git status exit 128 repro + cause
description:
Repro (repo root /Users/nef/gt/cube_streamer/polecats/furiosa/cube_streamer):
$ bd sync
Warning: failed to check for uncommitted changes: git status failed: exit status 128
→ Loaded 17 local issues from database
→ Loading base state...
  Loaded 15 issues from base state
→ Pulling from remote...
Error: pulling: git pull failed: exit status 1
fatal: couldn't find remote ref polecat/furiosa/cs-agv@mkipwvu5

More direct:
$ bd sync --no-pull --no-push --verbose
git worktree detected without sync-branch, using direct mode for safety
Warning: failed to check for uncommitted changes: git status failed: exit status 128
→ Exporting pending changes to JSONL...
Error: checking git status: git status failed: exit status 128

Cause evidence:
- Worktree .git points to /Users/nef/gt/cube_streamer/.repo.git/worktrees/cube_streamer2 (cat .git).
- git rev-parse --git-common-dir => /Users/nef/gt/cube_streamer/.repo.git (core.bare=true).
- git --git-dir /Users/nef/gt/cube_streamer/.repo.git status => fatal: this operation must be run in a work tree (exit 128).
- git --git-dir /Users/nef/gt/cube_streamer/.repo.git/worktrees/cube_streamer2 status works.
- GIT_DIR not set, permissions ok.

Likely bd is running git status against the bare common dir instead of the worktree gitdir/work-tree in this rig (bare repo + linked worktrees), which yields exit 128.

Suggested fix/workaround:
- Fix in bd: if git-dir != git-common-dir (worktree), run status with worktree gitdir + work-tree (git -C <worktree> status or git --git-dir <worktree_gitdir> --work-tree <worktree>). Avoid using bare common dir for status.
- Workarounds: configure sync.branch to use a dedicated sync worktree, or run bd sync from a standard non-bare clone; alternatively use bd sync --flush-only and do git ops from a non-bare clone.
- Separate issue: bd sync tries to pull polecat/furiosa/cs-agv@mkipwvu5 from origin (missing ref); use --no-pull or set upstream appropriately.
